oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-11-14 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 14, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performers Stonewall Jackson, Jean Shepard, and Don Gibson, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins with Buddy Harman, Minnie Pearl (roughly her 19th anniversary on the Opry), the Jordanaires, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1049th broadcast, the 34th anniversary of the Opry, and that the 8th annual WSM Country Music Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Archie Campbell; Stonewall Jackson; Tommy Jackson; Jean Shepard; Chet Atkins; Buddy Harman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- I'm Movin' On (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell) -- Hank Snow introduces Stonewall Jackson -- Waterloo (Stonewall Jackson) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson -- Snowflake Breakdown (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner introduces Jean Shepard -- A Satisfied Mind (Jean Shepard) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Boo Boo Stick Beat (Chet Atkins, Buddy Harman)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
